title: National Park Service selects David Szymanski as regional director
abstract: WASHINGTON – David Szymanski, a 25-year National Park Service (NPS) veteran, has been selected to serve as the regional director for the Pacific West Region, which includes all parks in California, Hawaii, Idaho, Nevada, Oregon, Washington, parts of Arizona and Montana, and the territories of Guam, American Samoa, and the Northern Mariana Islands. He begins his new role after the holidays.

image.altText: davidsyzmanski_1
image.title: davidsyzmanski_1
image.caption: The National Park Service has selected David Szymanski as the permanent Regional Director for the Pacific West Region.

relatedParks.fullName: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
relatedParks.name: Santa Monica Mountains

title: Yosemite Pile Burning - Wawona
abstract: Yosemite Fire is planning pile burning operations in the Wawona community with a focus on Forest Drive and the Bills Hill area. Burning may begin as early as Thursday, December 7 and continue into Friday, December 8. These piles are from mechanical treatment projects where materials were cut and gathered into piles by hand or with heavy equipment. Burning and removal of this material helps make forests more resilient to future wildfires and in communities, can help protect homes from the threat of future fires.

title: Erin Gates selected as superintedent of César E. Chávez National Monument
abstract: SAN FRANCISCO - The National Park Service (NPS) has selected Erin Gates to serve as the superintendent of César E. Chávez National Monument in Keene, California starting Jan. 14, 2024.

image.altText: Erin Gates
image.title: Erin_Gates

title: Additional areas of Death Valley NP’s backcountry reopened
abstract: Portions of Eureka Valley and Saline Valley opened on November 30. These are the most recent portions of Death Valley National Park to reopen after every road in the park was damaged by the remnants of Hurricane Hilary in August.

image.altText: Footprints on white sand dunes in front of dark mountains.
image.caption: Eureka Dunes

title: Volunteers help make Field of Dreams come true
abstract: Thirty seven volunteers came out to Manzanar National Historic Site over Veterans Day weekend to help clear the baseball field of prickly tumbleweeds and other plants, as well as storm debris that flooded the field during Tropical Storm Hilary in August of this year.

image.altText: group plays baseball on dirt field surrounded by bushes and mountains
image.title: Volunteers played another game of baseball after clearing the infield and placing bases on the field at Manzanar.
image.caption: Volunteers played another game of baseball after clearing the infield and placing bases on the field at Manzanar.

title: Echo Canyon, Hole in the Wall, Cottonwood, Marble, and Greenwater Valley open for camping with permit
abstract: Death Valley National Park continues to repair and reopen flood-damaged roads. Roadside camping is now available along Echo Canyon Road, Hole in the Wall Road, Cottonwood Canyon Road, Marble Canyon Road, and Greenwater Valley Road (aka Furnace Creek Wash Road). The free, mandatory camping permits are available at Furnace Creek Visitor Center, same day only.

image.altText: View of a distant wooden structure as seen framed by an old wooden window.
image.caption: The Inyo Mill is one of the features in Echo Canyon.

title: Motorcyclist rescued after driving on closed Titus Canyon Road
abstract: Two men were rescued by helicopter after they illegally drove on a closed road in Death Valley National Park. The National Park Service closed Titus Canyon Road temporarily due to hazardous conditions caused by flood damage.

image.altText: A brown gate, white concrete barriers, yellow "road closed", red "stop" sign, and white "Road Closed" sign with pictograms block a dirt road leading to distant mountains.
image.caption: The east entrance of Titus Canyon Road, which the motorcyclists went past.

title: 2023 Fire Restrictions Lifted in Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks
abstract: SEQUOIA AND KINGS CANYON NATIONAL PARKS, Calif. November 20, 2023 – Effective at 6:00 a.m. on Tuesday, November 21, 2023, Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks will no longer be in fire restrictions.

title: Shoshone entrance and Badwater Road re-opened
abstract: The southeast entrance to Death Valley National Park is now open. Badwater Road provides direct access from Shoshone, CA to the temporary lake at Badwater Basin.

image.credit: National Park Service & Federal Highway Administration
image.altText: Three photos of the same view of Badwater Road . Photo on left shows just the top of a speed limit sign sticking out of gravel. The middle photo shows one lane plowed through gravel. The photo on right shows the road fully cleared.
image.caption: Three photos of a dip on Badwater Road. The photo on the left was taken on September 4 and shows just the top of a speed limit sign. The middle photo shows parital debris cleared. The right photo shows the road cleared of flood debris.

title: National Park Service releases management plan for Mt. Wanda at John Muir National Historic Site
abstract: MARTINEZ, CA — Today, the National Park Service (NPS) released the Mt. Wanda Comprehensive Site Management Plan (CSMP) and the associated Finding of No Significant Impact (FONSI). The 370-acre planning area at John Muir National Historic Site is an important part of the ranch where John Muir lived. Prior to Muir's time, the site was owned by Ygnacio Martinez as part of the Mexican era Rancho El Pinole, and earlier was home to the Karkin Ohlone Indians. At Mt. Wanda, visitors can walk in John Muir's footsteps as they explore, research, and appreciate the wildness of this inspirational landscape.

title: Beach Wheelchair Available to Reserve at Drakes Beach
abstract: A beach wheelchair is now available for visitors to reserve for use at Drakes Beach in Point Reyes National Seashore.

image.altText: A park ranger with three women stand beside a beach wheelchair with a beach and a bay in the background.
image.title: The Beach Wheelchair Ribbon Cutting Ceremony at Drakes Beach on November 9, 2023.
image.caption: From left to right, PRNS Integrated Resources Program Manager Dave Press, PRNSA Executive Director Donna Faure, Ellen Greenblatt, and Margo Norman at the ribbon cutting ceremony for the park's new beach wheelchair on November 9, 2023.

title: Prepare for High Traffic in Joshua Tree National Park During Holiday Season
abstract: High traffic is anticipated on most weekends and during the week of Thanksgiving and the two weeks around Christmas and New Year's Day.

image.altText: Cars, trucks, and vans crowded into a parking area.
image.title: Traffic in the Park
image.caption: Cars, trucks, and vans crowded into a parking area.

title: Drowning at South Beach on Friday, November 10, 2023
abstract: The National Park Service responded to a possible drowning at South Beach on Friday, November 10, 2023. On November 14, 2023, the Marin County Coroner's Office positively identified the decedent as Richard Sumi, a 73-year-old male from Hercules, California.

title: Yosemite Pile Burning in November
abstract: Yosemite Fire crews are planning to conduct pile burning operations in three areas around the park this week. The first is along Northside Drive in Yosemite Valley, the second area is in the upper Mariposa Grove near the Washburn fire footprint, and the third is near Sentinel Dome at the radio repeater site. A map is available upon request.

title: 11-10-2023 Mojave National Preserve Closes Restroom and Parking area at Kelso for Renovations
abstract: KELSO, Calif. – Mojave National Preserve will be closing the public restrooms and parking area at the Kelso Depot beginning Monday November 13th for renovations. Alternate restroom facilities include the trailhead to Kelso Dunes, Hole-in-the-Wall Picnic area, and nearby gateway communities of Baker, Primm, and Amboy.

image.altText: Kelso Depot Restrooms
image.title: Kelso Depot Restrooms

title: Free entrance on Veterans Day
abstract: Entrance to Death Valley National Park will be free on Veterans Day. A temporary shallow lake at Badwater Basin and an astronomy program make this an ideal time to visit.

image.altText: White salt flat in the foreground with a shallow body of water extending across the field of view, with mountains on the edges.
image.caption: Park visitors enjoying the temporary lake at Badwater Basin.

title: Preventative Fire Management Program in Joshua Tree National Park
abstract: Joshua Tree National Park fire management and vegetation staffs are preparing for a fuel reduction project beginning November 13, 2023. This project will manipulate vegetation to affect fire behavior in specific areas in order to protect Joshua trees (Yucca brevifolia) and Joshua tree habitat.

image.altText: A crew of wildland firefighters in yellow Nomex turnouts hike across a desert landscape.
image.title: Wildland Firefighter Crew
image.caption: A crew of wildland firefighters in yellow Nomex turnouts hike across a desert landscape.

title: Tractor trailer hauling bees rolled over west of Towne Pass
abstract: A tractor trailer carrying beehives rolled over on CA-190 in Death Valley National Park on November 5, 2023. The driver and several emergency responders got stung by bees.

image.altText: Crashed semi truck in rocky area of a valley. Truck is collapsed and debris is scattered around the ground.
image.title: Truck crash.
image.caption: Tractor trailer after rollover.

title: On the 50th anniversary of the Endangered Species Act, Channel Islands plant species declared fully recovered
abstract: Ventura, Calif. - Two plants that live on California’s Channel Islands and nowhere else on earth – the Santa Cruz Island Dudleya and island bedstraw – have been declared fully recovered by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service due to the collaborative efforts of conservation partners and no longer require Endangered Species Act protections. The delisting of the two species arrives as the Endangered Species Act celebrates 50 years of conservation in 2023.

image.altText: small succulent plant with flowers
image.caption: Santa Cruz Island dudleya (Dudleya nesiotica) found on Santa Cruz island.

title: 48 new American citizens from 18 countries sworn in at naturalization ceremony at Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
abstract: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif.— On Thursday morning, 48 immigrants from 18 countries became United States citizens during a ceremony hosted by Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area (SMMNRA), a unit of the National Park Service, and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. See photos here.

image.altText: Newly naturalized citizen poses for a photo
image.title: Naturalization2023_9
image.caption: A newly naturalized citizen poses for a photo.

relatedParks.fullName: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
relatedParks.name: Santa Monica Mountains

title: Traffic collision caused by a tarantula
abstract: A motorcycle hit a van that braked suddenly to avoid running over a tarantula.

image.altText: A brown hairy spider with seven legs straddles a rock wall and gravel ground.
image.caption: A tarantula seen elsewhere in Death Valley National Park on the day of the accident.

title: Beatty entrance to reopen Nov. 1
abstract: The National Park Service will reopen Mud Canyon Road and Daylight Pass on November 1, 2023. Daylight Pass connects Death Valley National Park to NV-374 and Beatty, NV. Only emergency repairs have been completed, so drivers need to use caution.

image.altText: A woman in a green and gray National Park Service uniform stands on a damaged section of a paved road. Desert hills are in the background.
image.caption: Park Ranger Abby Wines stands in a damaged section of Daylight Pass Road on August 22, 2023. This was two days after flash floods triggered by the remnants of Hurricane Hilary.

title: Lassen Volcanic Planning Second Burn of the Season at Manzanita Lake
abstract: Lassen Volcanic National Park Fire Management personnel plan to initiate a 65-acre prescribed fire in the Manzanita Lake area, continuing the work of the multi-year Northwest Gateway Forest Restoration project (NWG). Ignition is planned for Wednesday, November 1st, unless weather conditions necessitate ignition the previous or following day.

title: Alcatraz Island celebrates 50 years of public tours
abstract: The National Park Service (NPS), Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy, and Alcatraz City Cruises jointly hosted an event Oct. 24 to recognize the 50th anniversary of the first public tour of Alcatraz Island. Special guests joined staff to celebrate the occasion and recount the island’s storied history that draws more than a million visitors each year.

image.altText: A group of people gathered around the dock on Alcatraz
image.title: A group of people gathered around the dock on Alcatraz
image.caption: Alcatraz Island is one of the most visited park sites with Golden Gate National Recreation Area.

title: Devils Postpile National Monument Seasonal Closure Update
abstract: Devils Postpile National Monument will be closed for the remainder of the season on Friday, October 27. There wil be no facilities, services, nor parking within the National Monument. No public programs, water, or bathroom facilities will be available.

title: 15th Anniversary Giacomini Wetlands Restoration Celebration
abstract: The public is invited to celebrate the 15th anniversary of the Giacomini Wetlands Restoration project at Point Reyes National Seashore. The free event will be held on Saturday, October 28.

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a newly restored wetland at the head of a long narrow bay between a forested ridge on the left and a grass-covered ridge on the right.
image.title: An aerial photo of the Giacomini Wetlands taken by Robert Campbell on February 10, 2009.
image.caption: An aerial photo of the Giacomini Wetlands taken on February 10, 2009.

title: Hiker Fatality on Mt. Whitney in Sequoia National Park
abstract: Tom Gerbier, a French National of Fontenay-sous-Bois, France, and pilot for Air France, was reported missing when he didn’t show up for his return flight. He started his hike from Whitney Portal early Tuesday morning, October 17, via the Mountaineering Route and was due back on a flight on Wednesday, October 18.

title: Prescribed Burn Planned West of the Cypress Tree Tunnel for Friday, October 20, 2023
abstract: Point Reyes National Seashore fire managers, in collaboration with the Marin County Fire Department, are monitoring conditions for an opportunity to implement a 12-acre prescribed burn west of the cypress tunnel and north of the lighthouse. This burn may begin on Friday, October 20, and is expected to last one to two days.

image.altText: Two wildland fire fighters wearing yellow shirts and helmets light beachgrass on fire in sand dunes.
image.title: Fire fighters performing a controlled burn of European beachgrass.

title: Yosemite Valley Prescribed Burns, October 2023
abstract: Yosemite fire crews are planning to conduct prescribed burning operations in Yosemite Valley within two units this week.

image.altText: Map showing the two units in Yosemite Valley where burning will take place
image.title: Map showing the two units in Yosemite Valley where burning will take place

title: Fall and Winter Pile Burns Planned in Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks
abstract: SEQUOIA AND KINGS CANYON NATIONAL PARKS, Calif. October 15 – Fire management staff at Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks are preparing to begin burning piles of cut vegetation in multiple locations throughout the parks. The work will be ongoing as conditions allow from October 21 – December 1, 2023.

title: Death Valley National Park will partially re-open October 15;
abstract: Death Valley National Park will partially reopen on Sunday, October 15. Visitors will be able enter the park via CA-190 from the west via Lone Pine or from the east via Death Valley Junction. All other park entrances will remain closed.

image.altText: Desert mountain landscape surrounding a salty flat valley with a thin layer of water on the valley flood reflecting the landscape.
image.title: Badwater Basin with water.
image.caption: Temporary lake at Badwater Basin, as of September 11, 2023.

title: Grant Grove Prescribed Burn Postponed Due to Dry Conditions
abstract: Fire management staff at Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks are postponing implementation of the Grant Grove Prescribed Burn, in the Grant Grove area of Kings Canyon National Park, due to dry fuel conditions within the unit. The parks hope to reschedule the prescribed burn, which was formerly scheduled to begin next week, for later this fall, but anticipate that it will be necessary to wait for the area to receive precipitation.

title: Grant Grove Prescribed Burn Planned in Kings Canyon National Park
abstract: Fire management staff at Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks plan to begin ignitions on the Grant Grove Prescribed Burn, in the Grant Grove area of Kings Canyon National Park on Sunday, October 15. 520 acres of burning are planned over the course of 4-6 days of ignitions.

title: Recovery Efforts Scaled Back for Missing Swimmer at Point Reyes National Seashore
abstract: Officials from the National Park Service (NPS) Point Reyes National Seashore have scaled back recovery efforts for swimmer Felix Louis N'jai, who was reported missing near Wildcat Beach at 10:20 am on Sunday, October 1, 2023.

image.altText: A black man wearing a plaid jacket laughs while sitting in a small camper van.
image.title: Felix Louis N'jai.
image.caption: Felix Louis N'jai

title: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks Announce a Determination on a Proposal to Re-establish Sequoia Seedlings in Sequoia Groves
abstract: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks are taking the next steps toward restoration recovery efforts for forests that were impacted by high severity fire during the 2020 Castle and 2021 KNP Complex Wildfires.

title: Removal of a Historic Grow Site at Point Reyes National Seashore on October 5, 2023
abstract: The National Park Service at Point Reyes National Seashore will remove trash and chemicals from a former illegal marijuana grow site operation near Laguna Trail on Thursday, October 5, 2023.

image.altText: Piles of black irrigation tubing and buckets surrounded by bushes.
image.title: Piles of debris at an illegal marijuana grow site within Point Reyes National Seashore on March 8, 2023.
image.caption: Trash and chemicals found at an old marijuana grow site.

title: Manzanar to temporarily change visitor center hours for two weeks
abstract: The main visitor center at Manzanar National Historic Site will reduce their days and hours of operation beginning Oct. 9 for two weeks. In addition, the center will have reduced hours on Friday, Oct. 6 and Sunday, Oct. 8. The visitor center will operate on a five-day schedule and be open from 9:30 am to 4:30 pm on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays. The center will be closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays. On Friday, Oct. 6 and Sunday, Oct. 8, the visitor center will be open from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.

image.altText: unfinished interior of wooden building with desk in the center and exhibits on walls
image.title: reduced Hours image Block 14 exhibits

title: Wawona Prescribed Burning, October 2023
abstract: Fire management is preparing to continue prescribed burning operations on the Studhorse unit which is south of the Wawona Hotel.

title: Whiskeytown's 2023 Harvest Festival
abstract: Whiskeytown's 2023 Harvest Festival.

image.altText: Heirloom Apple
image.title: Heirloom apple
image.caption: Heirloom apple at the Towerhouse Historic District.

title: National Park Service Hosts Special Fandango Campfire Program
abstract: Martinez, Calif. – Join the National Park Service for a free campfire program on Saturday, October 7, 2023, at John Muir National Historic Site (NHS) in Martinez, California. The program begins at 5:00 p.m. and lasts roughly 2 hours.  This special campfire program will be hosted by rangers from the Juan Bautista de Anza National Historic Trail. Step back into early California, when the Martinez Adobe was the heart of Rancho Pinole. The musical group Los Arribeños de San Francisco, led by Lance Beeson – a descendant of the Anza Expedition’s Second in Command Jose Joaquin Moraga – will share the songs, dances, and games of the Spanish and Mexican eras of Alta California.

relatedParks.fullName: Juan Bautista de Anza National Historic Trail
relatedParks.name: Juan Bautista de Anza

title: Recovery Efforts Continue for Missing Swimmer at Point Reyes National Seashore
abstract: Officials from the National Park Service and other agencies are continuing their search for a swimmer reported missing on the morning of Sunday, October 1, 2023, at 10:30 am, but officials are now calling the search a recovery effort.

title: Yosemite Pile Burning in Early October
abstract: During the first week of October, Yosemite fire crews will be conducting pile burning operations in Yosemite Valley along the El Capitan Crossover Road, and possibly near Cook's Meadow, Ahwahnee Meadow, and along sections of Northside Drive. Additional pile burning will take place along the Crane Flat Lookout Road.

image.altText: Map of Crane Flat area where pile burning will take place in October 2023
image.title: Map of Crane Flat area where pile burning will take place in October 2023

title: Search Continues for Missing Swimmer at Point Reyes National Seashore
abstract: Officials from the National Park Service and other agencies are continuing their search for a swimmer reported missing on the morning of Sunday, October 1, 2023, at 10:30 am near a remote area of Point Reyes National Seashore.

title: Joshua Tree National Park to Receive Grant from California State Parks’ Off-Highway Motor Vehicle Division
abstract: Joshua Tree National Park management is honored to be among the local and federal agencies, districts, and non-profit organizations to receive a portion of a $33.5 million California State Parks’ Off-Highway Motor Vehicle Division (OHMVR) grant.

title: Redwood National and State Parks Announces Fall Prescribed Fire Plans
abstract: Redwood National and State Parks plans to conduct a series of prescribed burns this fall in the prairies and oak woodlands of the Bald Hills east of Orick, California.

image.altText: Prescribed fire in the Bald Hills of Redwood National and State Parks
image.title: Prescribed burn in Redwood National and State Parks
image.caption: Prescribed fire in the Bald Hills of Redwood National and State Parks

title: Proposed rate changes for campgrounds and backcountry permits at Death Valley National Park
abstract: The National Park Service (NPS) is seeking public comments by October 25 on proposed fee changes for backcountry permits and campgrounds in Death Valley National Park. The NPS proposes to increase nightly campsite fees by $4 to $8. Some backcountry permits would become reservable in advance on Recreation.gov with a fee.

image.altText: A camper in a bucket hat sits next to a green tent reading a book. The campsite is among green and brown brush.
image.title: A camper reads at Mesquite Springs_K.Moses
image.caption: Camper reads next to their tent in Mesquite Springs Campground.

title: Sulphur Works Road Repair and Park Highway Temporary Closure Begins September 25
abstract: Lassen Volcanic National Park is expecting local contractor Hooker Creek Construction to begin working on the Sulphur Works area of Lassen Highway 89 road shoulder that has partially undermined the road. To accomplish this work, the contractor will need to close the road 8:00am to noon and 1:00pm to 5:00pm on weekdays. Public vehicles will be able to pass through the area before and after work hours, during a noon break, and on weekends. The construction takes place during the least busy time of the year with enough time to complete work before winter snows.

title: Lassen Volcanic Planning Burn at Manzanita Lake
abstract: Lassen Volcanic National Park Fire Management personnel plan to initiate a 135-acre prescribed fire in the Manzanita Lake area beginning September 23, pending weather conditions. This prescribed fire continues the work of the multi-year Northwest Gateway Forest Restoration project (NWG).

title: Lassen Volcanic to Waive Entrance Fee to Celebrate National Public Lands Day
abstract: All National Park Service sites, including Lassen Volcanic National Park, will offer free admission to visitors on September 23 for National Public Lands Day. “I encourage everyone to take advantage of this fee free day to explore and discover the beauty and recreational opportunities that Lassen Volcanic National Park has to offer,” said Superintendent Jim Richardson. “National Public Lands Day is a wonderful opportunity to explore the resilient landscape post-Dixie Fire of 2021 and, as September is National Wilderness month, it’s also a great time to be in and learn about the role of wilderness in our lives.”

title: Black Rock Art Gallery Opening of Sedimental
abstract: Joshua Tree National Park management is pleased to announce a new art exhibition by Joshua Tree-based artist Margeaux Walter, the Fall 2022 Artist in Residence. Sedimental is an exhibition of photographs in which the artist has photographed sections of the landscape, printed them onto fabric, and then sewn them into outfits and drapery.
